org.j2free.cache.impl.memory
Class MemoryFragmentCache

java.lang.Object
  org.j2free.cache.impl.memory.MemoryFragmentCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
FragmentCache<MemoryFragment>
@ThreadSafe
public class MemoryFragmentCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements FragmentCache<MemoryFragment>

Implements FragmentCache using an in-process Fragment storage built on a ConcurrentHashMap.

put

public MemoryFragment put(java.lang.String key,
                          MemoryFragment fragment)
Description copied from interface: FragmentCache
Associates the specified key to the specified Fragment in this cache. Neither the key nor the Fragment can be null. The Fragment can be retrieved by calling the get method with a key that is equal to the original key.

Specified by:
put in interface FragmentCache<MemoryFragment>
Parameters:
key - the key
fragment - the Fragment
Returns:
Previous Fragment of the specified key in this cache, or null if it did not have one.

putIfAbsent

public MemoryFragment putIfAbsent(java.lang.String key,
                                  MemoryFragment fragment)
Description copied from interface: FragmentCache
Associates the specified Fragment with the specified key if there is not one already. This is equivalent to 
      if (!cache.contains(key)) {
          cache.put(key, fragment);
      }
      return cache.get(key);
except that the action is performed atomically.

Specified by:
putIfAbsent in interface FragmentCache<MemoryFragment>
Parameters:
key - key with which the specified Fragment is to be associated
fragment - Fragment to be associated with the specified key
Returns:
Current Fragment associated with specified key. If the cache previously associated a Fragment with the specified key, the old Fragment is returned, otherwise the argument Fragment is returned.

replace

public MemoryFragment replace(java.lang.String key,
                              MemoryFragment expected,
                              MemoryFragment replacement)
Description copied from interface: FragmentCache
Replace Fragment for key only if currently mapped to some value. Acts as 
      if (cache.get(key).equals(expected)) {
          cache.put(key, replacement);
          return replacement;
      } else return cache.get(key);
except that the action is performed atomically.

Specified by:
replace in interface FragmentCache<MemoryFragment>
Parameters:
key - key with which the specified Fragment is associated
Returns:
Current Fragment associated with the specified key. If the previous Fragment equaled the expected, then the replacement Fragment is returned.

size

public int size()
Specified by:
size in interface FragmentCache<MemoryFragment>
Returns:
The number of fragments currently in the cache.

getStatistics

public FragmentCacheStatistics getStatistics()
Specified by:
getStatistics in interface FragmentCache<MemoryFragment>
Returns:
statistics about the current state of the cache, or historical data if the implementation supports that.

scheduleCleaner

public final void scheduleCleaner(long interval,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                                  boolean runNow)
Modifies the schedule the runs on. Non-blocking method, so two threads could theoretically schedule the cleaner at the same time and not interfere with each other.

Parameters:
interval - The time interval
unit - The time unit the interval is in
runNow -
